page.title: 15HOBBIES FROM CRANTOCK
page.content: The people we met had interesting hobbies - thats how they use their spare time. {Woodcarving:}Driftwood is collected from the beach and dried for about 3 years. Cherry, Lime and Oak are the best woods for carving. About 30 tools are needed, many of which are old and irreplaceable. Fish and bird shapes are often carved and then the wood is polished. {Crochet:}This is the art of making knots with a special hooked needle. The knotted thread 'grows' just like knitting. One lady made things like a peacock, a patch- work cathedral, a starched crochet vase for dried flowers and soft toy animals.{Lacemaking:}Lace is still made by some ladies in Crantock but we were not fortunate enough to see it.{ { }
